page.title: 16Norden Landscape
page.content: The settlements of Norden, Caldershaw and Cutgate, joined by ribbon development along the A60 trunk road, encroach onto the surrounding fields and are flanked by modern housing estates. This main road rises with increasing steepness towards the N.W. carrying traffic, including a bus service, to Burnley, Blackburn and Preston. It skirts Knowl Hill, a dominant landmark visible for many miles around. Open moorland and rough pasture enclosed by dry stone walls slope down to the valleys. Some of these valleys have been drowned and are now reservoirs. Wooded areas are sparse but established along the disused railway line. Disused quarries and mineshafts litter the higher moorland areas, criss-crossed with farm tracks and well worn footpaths. Lanehead is off this main route.
